newsitem.title: UK: Turkey's Emlakbank expected to launch debut bond.
newsitem.headline: Turkey's Emlakbank expected to launch debut bond.

text.p: Turkey's state-owned Emlakbank is expected to launch its debut Eurobond next week following investor presentations in Frankfurt and Zurich this Thursday and Friday, bankers said on Monday.
The bond is expected to be for 150 million marks with a five-year maturity, syndicate sources said.
Commerzbank and UBS will be joint lead managers for the transaction for Emlakbank -- one of Turkey's largest state-owned banks specialising in real estate development and financing.
Unofficial price talk is in a rough range of 350-370 basis points over three-month LIBOR, dealers said.
In May, Emlakbank said it planned to set up a new bank in Germany.
The bank also said it began procedures to open a branch office in New York and that it was starting off-shore facilities and establishing a branch in northern Cyprus.
The bank said the moves were part of its efforts to expand activities in commercial banking and foreign trade finance.
